moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5 Be7: Cxd5 is a bit better, I think, because Dxc4 will force bishop to move again: loss of tempo for white.
moves.7... h6: Stops possibility of a back-rank checkmate.
moves.8. Bh4 dxc4: g5 is unwise, it opens up and weakens my kingside
moves.10... b6 11. O-O Bb7 12. Re1 c5: Advance pawns to attack the queenside.
moves.14. Qe2 Bxf3 15. Qxf3 cxd4 16. Bxa6 dxc3:
all the trades seem good
A knight, a bishop, and 2 pawns, for a rook and 1 pawn
moves.20... Qc3: forks rooks (both unprotected) and renews threat of g5
moves.23. h4 Nd5: uncovers bishop with gain of tempo
uncovers queen to attack rook at b2
moves.30. Qb3:
attacks e6 pawn.
He is making many attacking moves that don't help him at all
